summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to TD Ameritrade, dated August 11, 2019, commanding the production of extensive financial records related to Jeffrey Epstein and associated entities/individuals from January 1, 2000 onward. The document includes a detailed rider listing 27 categories of requested records and a request for non-disclosure to preserve the confidentiality of the ongoing investigation.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Issued and signed the grand jury subpoena as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subpoena specifically requests all financial records for accounts associated with Jeffrey Epstein, identified by his name, date of birth (01/20/53), and SSN.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance/Record Production Deadline
events.description: The subpoena commands TD Ameritrade to appear before the grand jury or produce the requested records by this date.

events.title: Subpoena Issued
events.description: The grand jury subpoena is dated and issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, NY
U.S. Attorney's Office, Southern District of New York, 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
The Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The subpoena is part of an official federal grand jury investigation into suspected felonies, including violations of 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking), 1594(c), 2422(b) (coercing minors for prostitution), and 371 (conspiracy).

It seeks a vast array of financial records from TD Ameritrade related to Jeffrey Epstein and any associated entities/individuals, covering the period from January 1, 2000, to the present (August 2019).
The U.S. Attorney's Office explicitly requests TD Ameritrade to refrain from disclosing the existence of the subpoena to any third party to preserve the investigation's confidentiality.

The requested records include 'Know Your Customer' filings, account statements, signature cards, wire transfers, loan files, currency transaction reports, internal memoranda, correspondence, and even surveillance video/photos of transactions.

The document indicates the investigation was active and ongoing as of August 2019, focusing heavily on following Epstein's financial trails and identifying other individuals associated with his accounts.
